ert statement in the code I write.

n loaded at

See a) and that's not r=
eally a problem.

Depends on the semantics:
- - Java assert for *internal* =
pre/post-conditions/invariants
- - JUnit Assertions for *interface* pre/pos=
t-conditions, states

o create test cases

o test all possible cases, it's true that writing

es is very consuming.
There's still something like the 80/20-rule. Writing =
test cases to cover 80%
takes 20% of the time. So concentrate on these and =
on finding the most
valuable of those other 20% left.

But still it's less =
time consuming than repeatedly debugging sessions.
